args:
Using sanctified water from the cleansing fount,
the people of Paradise are purified of the
miasma's corruption. But with Madame's death,
the incident draws to a close with mysteries yet
unanswered. The apostles vow to stop Basileus's
plan to revive Satan, and return to the Church.
Morning...\nThe prince and the apostles reunite with their\nallies, who have completed the cleansing fount.
How are Pinon and Ryszarda?\nI heard they were injured.
Fortunately, the wounds they sustained\nfrom Basileus weren't all that serious.
Right now, they are purifying the\ntownspeople with sanctified water\nfrom the cleansing fount.
Must be tough for that girl'a yours,\nnearly gettin' offed by a guy she\nrespected to the moon and back.
That should do it. The miasma has been\npurged from all the villagers. Still...
Maaan... I have no confidence. Absolutely\nnone at all! I wish I could go back to\nbelieving I was a total babe magnet again.
Must I continue to live as a person?\nMust I continue to toil through this\nmiserable existence?
Um... Are things really okay like this?

Clinging to false memories is like
living a mere simulacrum of real life.
You can't get what you want unless you
accept reality for what it is.
We came here hoping to rekindle that old\nspark, but then Madame took away our\nmemories. We abandoned our daughter!
What could we ever say or do to show\nher how sorry we are?
Papa, Mama...?\nDo you remember me now?
Then can we go home together?
Oh, darling, I beg you to forgive us!
Not everything here turned out badly.
We'll be taking YOU to Church\nheadquarters. Now get walking!
Wait. I need to speak to her first.
You guessed that I had lost my father\nand sister. How?
Oh, that. It was simple. I heard about you\nfrom a man who was with Basileus.
So Basileus has other people in his corner.
He was a cheeky little rat. Wouldn't stop\nsmirking. He said something about being\nhead of the South Grastaea capital guard.
Harle? You must be mistaken.\nThat wasn't his name.
If I recall correctly, the name Basileus\ncalled him was—gaaah! AAAAAGH!

And so, with Madame's death, the Paradise
incident drew to a close. The prince and his
allies resumed their journey.
As for the apostles...
Madame's cause of death was evidently a\nheart attack. Could that have been caused\nby the demon that used her body? Or...
This case is steeped in mysteries.\nTake the demon that mimicked my form—\nwhatever was its true identity?
Basileus also mentioned that he came to\nParadise on orders from someone else.
The smirking man may not be his only ally.\nThere might be someone else above him.
It sounds like the prince and his friends\nmight be aware of who the first man is.
We'd be wise to keep in touch with them\nmoving forward in order to ascertain the\ntruth.
What I'm most concerned about,\nthough, is Basileus's objective.
The being he's trying to revive: ＂Satan.＂\nWe need to know who—or what—it is.

Let's report in to Regina first. We'll share
our intel on this incident with Nevin and
the others, and then come up with our
next move.
What is it, Little Pi?\nYou seem down.
Is it right for me to just go back to the\nChurch?
Are you worried about what happened\nwith your memories?
Faris and I agreed there's nothing to worry\nabout. Besides, you're the one who quelled\nthe sealing stone's miasma.
That doesn't change the fact that I caused\nsome serious trouble. Or that Basileus\ntook advantage of me...
Pinon, how do you think I became aware\nof Basileus's presence in town?
When you went to investigate Madame,\nI could tell you were lying because of\nsome subtle tics in your facial expressions.
I couldn't understand why someone as\nserious as you would do something like\nthat, though.

And after I mulled over every possibility,
I came to the extraordinary conclusion that
your memory must have been tampered
with prior to the undercover mission.
What are you trying to say?
He's saying that even though he knew you\nwere lying, his mind didn't jump to the\nconclusion that you had to be a traitor.
That's how much Faris trusts you.\nThe same goes for me too, obviously.
I don't know what to say, you two...
You realize that the reason why Faris\ncontinued his investigation separately\nfrom us was for your sake, right?
Once he knew Basileus was using you,\nhe thought you could be hurt.
Look. If you think you've been a let-down\nsomehow, then make up for it in your\nwork, Pinon.

Little Pi, even if you're going to be hard on
yourself about all of this, the fact is that
you're an apostle, and everyone accepts
and approves of you.
If there's ever anything gnawing at you,\nknow that you can always talk to me.\nI'm your partner, after all!
If you've got your head back on straight,\nlet's move. Our allies are waiting at HQ.
